Title: EFCC arraigns lawyer, firm over alleged N27m land fraud
Summary: A lawyer, Victor Azubike Awah, has been arraigned before a Lagos Special Offences Court, Ikeja, over an alleged N27 million fraud . The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) arraigned the lawyer and firm .

Title: Lawyers seek overhaul of real estate transactions
Summary: Legal practitioners have called for greater regulatory harmonisation, transparency, and meticulous documentation to strengthen Nigeria’s real estate sector and enhance investor confidence . Legal practitioners call for greater regulation harmonisation and transparency .

Title: SAN, judge task lawyers on integrity, professional ethics
Summary: Adeyinka Olumide-Fusika urged newly elevated Senior Advocates of Nigeria to uphold the highest standards of integrity and ethics in the legal profession . SAN, judge task lawyers on integrity, professional ethics .

Title: Energy experts harp on law reforms to drive investment
Summary: Stakeholders in the oil and gas industry have called for synergy in law reforms, policy and innovation to drive growth and investment in Nigeria’s energy sector .

Title: Court acquits 12 accused of killing female police inspector in Rivers
Summary: A Rivers State High Court sitting in Port Harcourt has discharged and acquitted 12 persons accused of killing Police Inspector Christiana Erekere at the Taaba Police Division in Khana Local Council .

Title: Former Kwara lawmaker, Saheed Popoola dumps APC for PDP
Summary: Hon. Saheed Popoola is a two-term member of the Kwara State House of Assembly . He is a chieftain of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) in the state . Popoola joined the opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) alongside his supporters in APC in Offa, Offa local

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, October 28, 2025
Summary: As of the latest reporting time today, the official exchange rate in the NFEM stands at approximately ₦1,457.06 per US Dollar .

Title: FirstBank demonstrates effective assets and liability management with Eurobond Redemption
Summary: The Eurobond was issued as Senior Notes in October 2020 at 8.625% with semi-annual coupon payments, which was 70% oversubscribed at 70% . FirstBank demonstrates effective assets and liability management .

Title: PTML Customs generates N116bn in Q3
Summary: Port and Terminal Multi-Services Limited (PTML) Command of the Nigeria Customs Service generated N116.2 billion in revenue for the third quarter of 2025, Q3’25, representing a 34.3 per cent increase from the N86.5 billion recorded in the same period of 2024 .

Title: Anambra poll: INEC extends PVC collection
Summary: The Independent National Electoral Commission has extended the ongoing collection of Permanent Voter Cards in Anambra State . The decision followed appeals from citizens and stakeholders seeking more time for eligible voters to collect their cards ahead of the November 8, 2025 governorship election . The exercise, which was earlier scheduled to end on Sunday, October 26, will now continue

Title: FMC promises probe as power outage stalls operation midway
Summary: The Federal Medical Centre, Abeokuta, Ogun State, has promised a probe after a dental operation was abruptly halted on Monday following a sudden power outage . The attending dentist, identified simply as Dr. Adedoyin, reportedly stopped the procedure midway after the hospital experienced a blackout, citing the unavailability of electricity and a faulty

Title: FG urged to honour agreement with ASUU
Summary: An educationist, Dr Joseph Otuagoma, has urged the Federal Government to honour its agreement with the Academic Staff Union of Universities to prevent persistent strikes by lecturers . He made the appeal while addressing reporters in Lagos recently . He said frequent ASUU strikes are one of the major reasons for declining confidence in public universities .

Title: Funding crisis derailing fight against violence on women – UN
Summary: UN Women, in a report published on Monday, warned that aid cuts, shutdown or suspension of one in three women’s anti-violence programmes . One in three have suspended or shut down programmes aimed at ending gender-based violence . More than 40 per cent have scaled back or closed essential services such as shelters, legal aid,

Title: PUNCH, Premium Times join Nigeria Health Watch for health dialogue
Summary: A non-profit health communication and advocacy organisation, Nigeria Health Watch, in collaboration with The PUNCH and Premium Times, will on Wednesday, October 29, host a high-level webinar titled “Investing in Health in a Limited Fiscal Space .” The webinar aims to build on the outcomes of the recently concluded National
